radiographic_examinations.findings: Findings consistent with atelectasis in the base of the right lung, unchanged from 5 years earlier, and was otherwise normal.
Hypodensity and mass effect in the right temporal lobe and insula, with preservation of the adjacent cortex and without intracranial herniation or hydrocephalus.

radiographic_examinations.procedure_name: Magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) of the head
radiographic_examinations.findings: A solitary lesion (2.6 cm in diameter) in the right insula, with thin, smooth, peripheral enhancement and extensive surrounding edema and mild mass effect.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Repeat MRI showed a T2-weighted hyperintense lesion (3.4 cm in diameter) with thin, smooth peripheral enhancement and heterogeneous foci of restricted diffusion centrally.

radiographic_examinations.findings: Scattered nodules, 2 to 5 mm in diameter, in the middle lobe and a minor fissure of the right lung, bilateral hilar lymphadenopathy, and trace pleural effusions.
Marked hepatomegaly and mild splenomegaly. Mild portacaval, paraaortic, iliac, and mesenteric lymphadenopathy. A small amount of ascites.
